messages.content: ComfyUI-Nexus is a custom node designed to enable seamless multi-user workflow collaboration in ComfyUI.
How can other users connect to ComfyUI-Nexus?
Other users only need the URL provided by the server to connect locally or remotely to ComfyUI-Nexus.
What are the key features of ComfyUI-Nexus?
ComfyUI-Nexus provides multiuser collaboration, local and remote access, enhanced teamwork, real-time chat, spectate mode, admin permissions, and workflow backup.
To disable ComfyUI-Nexus, stop ComfyUI, go to the 'ComfyUI\custom_nodes' folder, rename 'ComfyUI-Nexus' to 'ComfyUI-Nexus.disabled', and restart ComfyUI.
What permissions are available in ComfyUI-Nexus?
ComfyUI-Nexus has three main permissions: viewer, editor, and queue prompt. Admins have all permissions by default.
How can you activate the chat window in ComfyUI-Nexus?
To activate the chat window in ComfyUI-Nexus, press 't'.
What chat commands are available in ComfyUI-Nexus?
ComfyUI-Nexus supports three chat commands: '/nick <name>' to change your nickname, '/login <account> <password>' to become an admin, and '/logout' to log out the admin.
How can admins control joined users in ComfyUI-Nexus?
Admins can use the user panel in ComfyUI-Nexus to enable/disable spectate mode, give/revoke editor and queue permissions, and show/hide the mouse of other players.
